sections.heading: Why in Japanese
sections.content:
Japanese has several ways to ask "why":

なぜ (naze) - formal/written どうして (doushite) - neutral/conversational なんで (nande) - casual

なぜですか？ "Why is it?" どうして来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" なんで？ "Why?" (casual)

children.heading: Usage
children.content:
More formal, common in writing and formal speech:

なぜですか？ "Why is it?" なぜそう思いますか？ "Why do you think so?" なぜ日本語を勉強しますか？ "Why do you study Japanese?" なぜ行かなかったのですか？ "Why didn't you go?"

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Formal tone Common in writing Used in business/academic contexts Can sound stiff in casual conversation

children.heading: Usage
children.content:
Most common in everyday conversation:

どうして？ "Why?" どうして来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" どうして日本語を勉強するの？ "Why do you study Japanese?" どうして遅れたの？ "Why were you late?"

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Natural conversational tone Most versatile Safe choice for most situations Can express concern or curiosity

children.heading: Usage
children.content:
Very casual, used with friends and family:

なんで？ "Why?" なんで来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" なんで怒ってるの？ "Why are you angry?" なんで泣いてるの？ "Why are you crying?"

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Very casual Common among friends Can sound accusatory if not careful Often used when surprised

sections.heading: Comparison
sections.content: Most Formal → Most Casual なぜ → どうして → なんで なぜ遅れましたか？ (formal) どうして遅れたの？ (neutral) なんで遅れたの？ (casual) "Why were you late?"

children.heading: から (kara) - Because
children.content:
Most common way to answer:

Q: どうして日本語を勉強しますか？ "Why do you study Japanese?" A: 日本に住んでいるからです "Because I live in Japan" Q: なぜ来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" A: 忙しかったから "Because I was busy"

children.heading: ので (node) - Because (softer)
children.content:
More objective reason:

Q: どうして遅れたの？ "Why were you late?" A: 電車が遅れたので "Because the train was delayed"

children.heading: 〜んです (explanatory)
children.content:
Provides explanation:

Q: どうして行かないの？ "Why won't you go?" A: お金がないんです "It's because I don't have money" A: 忙しいんです "It's because I'm busy"

children.heading: なぜなら (nazenara) - "That's because"
children.content:
Formal explanation:

日本語を勉強します。なぜなら、日本に住んでいるからです "I study Japanese. That's because I live in Japan"

children.heading: どうしてかというと - "The reason is"
children.content: 行きません。どうしてかというと、忙しいからです "I won't go. The reason is because I'm busy"

children.heading: Present/Future
children.content: なぜ行きますか？ "Why will you go?" どうして勉強するの？ "Why do you study?" なんで食べないの？ "Why don't you eat?"

children.heading: Past
children.content: なぜ行きましたか？ "Why did you go?" どうして来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" なんで言わなかったの？ "Why didn't you say?"

children.heading: Example 1: Explaining
children.content: A: どうして遅れたの？ "Why were you late?" B: 電車が遅れたんです "The train was delayed" A: そうだったんだ "I see"

children.heading: Example 2: Curiosity
children.content: A: なぜ日本語を勉強していますか？ "Why are you studying Japanese?" B: 日本の文化が好きだからです "Because I like Japanese culture" A: いいですね "That's nice"

children.heading: Example 3: Concern
children.content: A: どうして泣いてるの？ "Why are you crying?" B: 悲しい映画を見たから "Because I watched a sad movie" A: そうなんだ "I see"

children.heading: Example 4: Casual
children.content: A: なんで来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" B: 忘れてた "I forgot" A: え！？ "What!?"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using too formal in casual context
children.content: Too formal with friends: なぜですか？ ⚠️ More natural: どうして？or なんで？ ✓ "Why?"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using なんで in formal situations
children.content: Too casual: なんで遅れましたか？ ❌ Better: どうして遅れましたか？ ✓ Or: なぜ遅れましたか？ ✓ "Why were you late?"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing なんで with 何で
children.content: なんで (why) - reason question 何で (what/how by what means) - method なんで行くの？ "Why will you go?" 何で行くの？ "How will you go?" (by what means)

children.heading: Neutral Inquiry
children.content: どうして日本語を勉強しますか？ "Why do you study Japanese?" (curious)

children.heading: Accusatory Tone
children.content:
Can sound accusatory depending on intonation:

なんで言わなかったの！？ "Why didn't you tell me!?" (upset) どうして来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" (can be accusatory)

children.heading: Concerned
children.content: どうしたの？ "What's wrong?" (concerned) どうして泣いてるの？ "Why are you crying?" (concerned)

children.heading: どうしたの？ (doushita no?)
children.content:
"What's wrong? / What happened?"

A: どうしたの？ "What's wrong?" B: ちょっと疲れた "I'm a bit tired"

children.heading: どうしたんですか？ (polite)
children.content: A: どうしたんですか？ "What happened?" B: 財布を失くしました "I lost my wallet"

children.heading: なぜか (nazeka)
children.content:
"For some reason/somehow"

なぜか悲しい "I'm sad for some reason" なぜかわからない "I don't know why"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: なんで？ "Why?" どうして？ "Why?"

children.heading: Neutral/Polite
children.content: どうしてですか？ "Why is it?" なぜですか？ "Why is it?"

children.heading: Formal
children.content: なぜでしょうか？ "Why might it be?" どうしてでしょうか？ "Why might it be?"

children.heading: Basic Questions
children.content: なぜですか？ "Why is it?" どうして来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" なんで？ "Why?"

children.heading: With Different Topics
children.content: なぜ日本語を勉強しますか？ "Why do you study Japanese?" どうして遅れたの？ "Why were you late?" なんで怒ってるの？ "Why are you angry?" どうして行かないの？ "Why won't you go?"

children.heading: Answers
children.content: 忙しいからです "Because I'm busy" 電車が遅れたので "Because the train was delayed" お金がないんです "It's because I don't have money"

children.heading: Special Expressions
children.content: どうしたの？ "What's wrong?" どうしたんですか？ "What happened?" なぜかわからない "I don't know why"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Question Words (5W1H) - Overview から (kara) - Because ので (node) - Because (objective) 〜んです - Explanatory form Reasons & Causes - Expressing reasons なぜなら - That's because
